website_summaries.verdict: This graphics card provides its user with a great range of customizable options and the same incredible 4K visual clarity at slightly less expensive price point than other high-end cards.
pros: Powered by the advanced GeForce RTX platform
Wing-blade fans excel at repelling dust
GPU Tweak II allows for deep levels of personal customization
cons: Its quiet fan and ability to output gorgeous levels of environmental effects come at a relatively high price

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy scattered colored boxes, games crash
customer_reviews.text: GPU shows glitchy squares on desktop. During video games, scattered, colored boxes appear and moments later the system crashes and I get blue screen of death. I've had to re-install windows twice as a result (gave it a second chance). Re-installed windows a 3rd time, but this time without the RTX 2070, and PC has been working flawlessly since. I really wished this GPU would have worked. I returned it and I might even be dumb enough to buy it again, hoping I just got a defective one. System: Windows 10 64bit i8700k (OC 5.1ghz) 16gb RAM Motherboard: ROG Maximus X Code
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Good device if works
customer_reviews.text: I heard that there are some problems with new NVidia graphics, but I'm an optimistic person and understand that internet tends to have more bad than good reviews. Unfortunately, this time it happened to me and graphics card stopped working after 6 hrs of fantastic gaming experience, and I think that paying 100$ per hour of gaming is a little bit too much. I'd definitely try to get another 2070 after NVidia makes their quality more stable. Advantages: - High quality of assembling - Nice features - Excellent gaming experience Disadvantages: - Worked for 6 hrs only, then artefacts started to appear and drivers failed to initialize - Minimalistic package
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Falovskiy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This is no aceptable for the price range, would not bother in getting a new one. Started artifacting after 10 minutes of gaming ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazonas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy RTX right now
customer_reviews.text: So after some research I found out why so many of these RTX cards are experiencing these issues. The memory modules inside the card are made by two different companies, Samsung and Micron. Micron memory modules have been experiencing failures across all of the brands and lines of card. Since there is no way to know which company's memory modules are going to be in your card, it's probably best just to stay away from RTX right now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but top of the line 2070
customer_reviews.text: So, far far as 2070 cards go, this one is expensive. However, Asus also probably has the best cooler attached when it comes to thermals vs noise. It even has a bios switch with quiet and performance modes. Quiet mode is extremely quiet while still keeping operable temperatures. Performance mode will give you audible noise, but it will still be cooler and quieter than most of the competition. Only the MSI gaming Z is close. EVGA, despite having excellent warranty support and good pricing, has mediocre coolers. If you are noise focused and have a little bit of extra cash, this is probably the card you want to go for.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy at all
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about two weeks then it went bad on me with artifacting. Sent it in to ASUS for RMA and the one I got back went bad again after two weeks the exact same way both times just trying to play a new game. On top of the fact ASUS customer support is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I got this card a week ago and it worked great out of the box. But after just a week of gaming, work, etc., the card began showing artifacts and crashing my games. Will definitely be RMAing this product. Hopefully the next 2070 doesn't die on me this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VGA Error : Error code 43
customer_reviews.text: I like the ASUS graphics card. However, the failure of the graphics card was unpleasant. But thanks for handling it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: rookie0321

customer_reviews.title: Not dead lol!
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade from my aging GTX 970 3.5 GB (lul). Nice looking card, great build quality and perfect for 1440p gaming! UPDATE 9/28/19 Card still runs perfectly. No artifacts or whatsoever. UPDATED 6/3/19: After 2 months of i bought this card, it still works. I haven't done any overclocking though. The issue where RTX cards are failing prematurely are PROBABLY due to bad yields of the first batches.
customer_reviews.author: R Lansangan

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome... (update 5/2/19)
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is second to none... it's big though and the same size as a 2080... make sure you have the room. Performance is almost as good as a stock 2080 when OCed so definitely the worth the savings... even though all RTX cards are overpriced by 20-30%. Update 5/2/19: had to RMA card... all games started to crash/freeze while playing within the first 1-2 mins under load. No temp issues... probably just bad VRAM or the like. Had to change to 3/5 for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Angel

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the future...
customer_reviews.text: This card is the perfect medium for ultra settings @ 1080p with 60-120 fps on any game i have played. I would have liked to get the 2080 but the price increase didn’t warrant the extra 300$. I have a feeling someone is trying to sabatoge the reviews on this line of cards because this card is exactly what i was hoping/expecting. I also had an issue with redeeming my free game code with the purchase and Nvidias customer support was all over the issue and resolved it immediately. Awesome Card, Awesome company. The asus software streamlines with any other aura syncing and has its own user friendly overclocking software
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, works fast!
customer_reviews.text: The best version of the new Nvidia RTX 2070 in my oppion. Has all the RAM you need to run neural networks and run games like GTA V at 200 FPS (500 FPS in Minecraft). I mean I could go on and on about how good this card is but it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and beefy
customer_reviews.text: I normally go for EVGA cards but I decided to go outside the box and I was not disappointed. I love the graphic and I can play on ultra on almost all games. It is an big card though and it will dictate what case it needs to fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf1044

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you nvidia.
customer_reviews.text: Manafort. Purchased this card to replace my 980 ti, it worked great the first day, on the second day I started seeing artifacting on the bios screen and sometimes it would hang up and reboot. Once I finally started world of tanks and joined a match. I didint get past the count down part of the match before the screen started artifacting and the eventually the pc crashed and rebooted. I am very disappointed in nvidia for releasing these junk cards with out quality control checking them.
customer_reviews.author: NorA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've had this graphics card installed for 2 months now and I couldnt be happier. Havent had the artifacting problems that seemed to plague the 2080 and 2080ti. Card runs cool and hasnt skipped a beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I received the 2070 as advertised. AURA mode sync worked perfectly after downloading an updated version of the software. Getting 60+ FPS on Ultra for AC Odyssey at 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all!
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all from this and it runs amazing on every game. When I first got it It came in great condition and the packaging looked amazing. It had been 3-5 months and it still works fine, no problems at all. I would recommend you buying this. :) The highest the temperature has gone is 68* c from running Assassins Creed Odyssey for 3 hours. Otherwise the temperature stay 33*c having a few things open and 20*c with google chrome open and discord.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Fast card, benches above 1080 but below 1080ti. Since they stopped making 1080s, this is the alternative. All the deals on 1080s seem gone. It is a very cool and quiet card. Their doesn't seem to be much to be gained doing manual overclocking though, maybe a couple percent, but built in OC setting just screams anyway.
customer_reviews.author: W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: rtx 2070 upgraded from 1060
customer_reviews.text: It barely fit in my phanteks p300 case. But it runs perfectly. Upgraded from a 1060 and there is a huge difference! I am able to run games (OW, Fortnite) consistently at 144 on high settings 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Karena Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Looker
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an elegant beast. I swapped out a GTX 1060 For it. I was excited and deleted msi afterburner and riva Tuner because I wanted to use GpuTweak2, I then found out it really doesn’t work, “for me at least. The gpu clock wasn’t displaying correctly and it doesn’t even work for my Ryzen 5 2600 cpu as far as watching the temps. 1080p on ultra for division 2 provided 60 to 100+ frames and the card was barely even warm 55c. *update 5/14. I run at 1440p 144hrtz division 2, fortnite, battlefield 5 with high refresh rates. Ray tracing I haven’t really tried.
customer_reviews.author: justin webb

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the other reviews, don’t think “this won’t happen to me”
customer_reviews.text: new pc just built, all that was left was the graphics card and this seemed to be the best card i could find for a reasonable price. the card is great at gaming but about a week in a started getting artifacts that would freeze my whole system, happened twice then my whole system shut down so i knew it was time to return it, unsure on what to get next as i see many reviews saying the same thing for most 2070 models, disappointing
customer_reviews.author: anna vukovich

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding GPU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card because I wanted the option to run RTX in the games I play. I don't necessarily use it all the time, but the option is there for me and that's what I wanted. I am very impressed with how cool and QUIET this card runs. This is by far the best GPU I've ever owned. I expect it will last a number of years. I also expect the implementation of ray tracing technology to improve during this card's life cycle. Sturdy construction and ASUS quality are what this card is all about.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Best performance power dollar
customer_reviews.text: The best price point for the performance offered. I did purchase the RTX 2080 and then changed my mind when I reevaluated what I wanted from my build. This card plays all my games in 4k at or over 60fps and it was $300 cheaper then the card I chose initially. The RGB features are beautiful, I have it vertically mounted to show it off, and under load against the side panel the heat doesn't affect performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love the product for the first month ran siege,overwatch bunch of other games on ultra settings with 200fps. And then about after a month it would just crash and crash. Then started getting artifacts on screen. Redid windows and drivers several time. Ended up just returning. Returning was super fast and easy no pain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua c.

customer_reviews.title: It’s dead Jim!
customer_reviews.text: Artifacting after a week. Nvidia needs to fix the issues with the 20xx cards. Mine is going back to Asus tomorrow. Asus themselves were easy to deal with, and honestly this is an Nvidia issue not Asus issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast with RGB LEDs
customer_reviews.text: This video card it great. I love the configurable RGB LEDs. It runs cool with 3 fans, but is a bit longer than 2070's with only 2 fans. The RGB software makes Fortnite think I have hacking software and closes, so I can't keep the RGB the colors I want when playing Fortnite.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build
customer_reviews.text: I honestly bought this to match my Asus ROG Z390I and discovered that this is an amazing machine. Due to the metal shroud it has very little to no GPU sag (I can't tell). The fans do get loud and it does get hot. One thing I recently discovered is that it has a few fan headers so they can be used for additional fans if you don't have a splitter or enough headers on the mobo.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I bought a new product, but the used one came
customer_reviews.text: My graphics card box was also not sealed on one side. The inner box was damaged as well, and the plastic package that sealed the graphics card was sealed with a worn tape. It is finally returning now. And I am hesitating to repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Songee Park

customer_reviews.title: Died within a week
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I got this card and the first day my games looked AMAZING but over time the week of having it my PC started freezing, screeching, and graphics would freak out. It was so bad I couldn't even keep my computer up and running. Ended up the card was bad and I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: High Quality! Is an ASUS! Enough Said!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t even overclocked it yet and rocks right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Davis

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Withing the first 20 minutes of gameplay, artifacts began to appear and got worse as time went on. I restarted my computer, I made sure the drivers were up to date and nothing fixed it. It appears to be a common issue. After the restart, I tested it again and it got so bad that the GPU crashed and the computer had to be restarted. I am returning it and plan to research extensively and find a replacement. Save your money, go with a different card.
customer_reviews.author: Meri Anglin

customer_reviews.title: Care OC software
customer_reviews.text: The product works fantastic however beware. Upon install I ran the Asus overclocking software to auto OC the card and it clocked way above stable and took my temp to 91c. May have damaged my card. Just beware the Asus software.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: glitching lights and crashing
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten the chance to play on my PC for a while, so I missed the return window for amazon. I noticed a similar issue to this on fallout new vegas when I tried to download a lighting mod for it but just thought it was the mod being jank. It wasn't until I tried to play borderlands 3 that I figured out that it was an issue with any newer or graphical intensive game. I downloaded a rtx shader for minecraft and it gave me the same issue. I don't know if they fixed this issue by now, but I am pretty annoyed I wasted 450 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It still works 2000 hours later after rough abusive OC gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great Card, almost 2000 hours in gaming with it, and I overclock and run highest settings on AAAA games only. I literally abuse my pc and the GPU more specifically. Not the best card in performance choices, but for the 2070, 8GB. It performs 100% as it should! I have it sitting horizontally, I heard a lot of issues with vertical mounts. I dont have a horizontal mount stability bar for it. It's heavy/hefty, make sure you have the clearance for this card. Check your dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Best 2070 out of all the brands
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research and watched benchmark videos and this one was the top 2070 at stock speed and I can only imagine when overclocked that it can be almost 2080 like. It has 3 fans with big backplate and plenty of RGB 1080p LED Sony lights to give it even more scooter cores than the human eye can see . Plus I got it for $450 used on here Amazon refurb certified so you cant beat it
customer_reviews.author: RA Deleon

customer_reviews.title: Great card for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a gtx 970 to this and I couldn’t be happier. I’ve always liked the potential that the 70 line has without being as expensive as the 80 line. This card does not disappoint. You can run any modern game at pretty much max settings if your CPU can handle it as well. The ray tracing and dlss is quite interesting as well and I’m excited to see it get more advanced and expansive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Epic gaming Card
customer_reviews.text: I cant complain, i jump from a nvidia 1070 to this piece of tech, after some tweeks on the fan graph as to any other card its practicaly non heating on super high modes. The color part match perfectly to the rest of things i buy for my PC
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is large! Make sure you have room in your case, mine had to be modified to fit properly. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M

customer_reviews.title: Untested DOA ! Used
customer_reviews.text: Asus Strix RTX 2070 works for a few hours. After install the latest NVIDIA drivers from the website. The entire screen has artifacts and restart several times. Last solution. Return back to Amazon Warehouse. Very unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy, but be careful on used products or open boxed editions
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from 960 to 2070. Worth the buy! But make sure to check the product's boxes. I had to return the first one I bought because both outer and inner boxes were damaged. One end wasn't sealed as well. Also the gpu plastic itself isn't sealed too. On the bright side, I got the new box completely sealed and unused!
customer_reviews.author: Varivax

customer_reviews.title: Runs great!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about buying this card due to seeing a lot of bad issues with any RTX card but ive had this card for a week and i am beyond happy! it runs any game i throw at it on ultra getting 80+ FPS. This was my first build myself and install was very simple as long as you know where things go! very glad i went with this card and very happy with the performance!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this Graphics card is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The moment I booted my system up with this card I've been awed.. I'm glad I treated myself to this upgrade. I can now do VR gaming and maybe even 4K.. Just glad I bought this. Amazon did a great job of getting it out to me quickly and at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Klein

customer_reviews.title: New RTX graphics, RGB; well made card (once I got one that works)
customer_reviews.text: The original GPU I received from Amazon was defective. Asus customer service was extremely helpful. They sent me a replacement card pretty quickly. The replacement card is running great. Metro Exodus looks beautiful and the FPS stays pretty solid on the ultra settings. Plus, the RGB is cool, in sync w/my Asus MOBO. Overall I'm very satisfied w/my purchase. Feel like still priced just a little too high, but I was in the market now. Would definitely recommend this GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M

customer_reviews.title: Great Card
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a few days and have thrown Metro Exodus with full details and RTX on against it. No issues so far, very fast card. The visuals in Metro Exodus are truly next gen with RTX enabled and at extreme quality settings. Unparalleled. UPDATE: Been a month, and this thing is purring along!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Never received my games but solid video card
customer_reviews.text: The card had been working great for me although when I purchased the card I was supposed to receive 2 free games. I never got an email or code sent to me about that and still haven't received my free games. I tried contacting support and I did receive a code but it doesn't work anywhere not even with Nvidia. But over all the hardware is pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bolwerk

customer_reviews.title: If you're a minesweeper player then look no further.
customer_reviews.text: This card absolutely slays minesweeper. Played non stop for about 15 hours. No stutters, hiccups, or frame rate drops. Solitaire's another ball game but the rog strix oc is perfect for minesweeper.
customer_reviews.author: Jacobi

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise, there are RGB LEDs around thenfans and on the back. The backplate looks fantastic. The LEDs sync with my MB through Asus Aura. As a 1080 gamer with future plans of changing to 1440 this is more than enough card to run all AAA games on max setting.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bonewell

customer_reviews.title: ROG STRIX
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all this card is amazing and yes hey are releasing a 2070 super but early benchmarks show only a 10 to 12 percent increase on reference models so i would still highly recommend this card and the price should come down when the super is released you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very good card, 100% happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Play any games on whichever setting I like. Haven't had one issue with the card, drivers, performance, install, nothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Asus best in class for 2070 GPU
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and well built, Overclockable runs cool with the triple fans. I highly recommend it. I have mine overclocked to 2100 Mhz after benchmarks I am in the 95% on 3dmark benchmark. If you are building a new system and want great performance without breaking the back grab this.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Garrity

customer_reviews.title: ROG products are top notch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent GPU, no issues whatsoever so far. I really like most ROG products in general and this one did not disappoint. Make sure you have clearance to install the card since it is fairly large.
customer_reviews.author: David Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: First One Defective
customer_reviews.text: The first graphics card I received died after less than two weeks. Lots of artifacts appeared before the graphics card failed. Makes me question the "144-Hour Validation Program" ASUS puts these cards through. Amazon was quick to send a replacement which has been in my computer since Dec 5th with no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: worked for about 6 months and then crapped out with a Error 43
customer_reviews.text: i have registered this product and cannot find a way to talk to Asus.... i have talked to amazon "support" who ask me 3 questions and then ask me to start typing to get redirected to another "support" person. absolute garbage customer service and way to figure out even if i am eligable for warranty repair or replacement... buy it but if it stops working, your out 523.00 USD or whatever its listed at!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome step up from rx 580
customer_reviews.text: I /was/ skeptical of this card from the whole artifacting thing that happened a while back but it was probably fairly small since this card is working perfectly. I play at 1080p 165hz and this card smashes that no problem. My old card could hardly keep up at 89 degrees Celsius the whole time. The 2070 however does better at like 59 degrees max usually. Nvidia also has a cool feature to auto record screen shots and clips in some games so I don't forget lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective graphics card
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this used card and i noticed right away that 4 of the fan blades were missing from the left fan. After plugging it in my computer, the compter did not recognise my fully functional pcie cables in the graphics card and said there werent any in so i ordered a replacement which was artifacting on screen after installing the latest drivers and nvidia software on my computer. Was 0/2 with these used card and i think they may be used for mining and have had the life sucked out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great card!
customer_reviews.text: Runs all the games I play at high settings. Pretty cool and quiet. Looks great. Awesome card.
customer_reviews.author: Poet256

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU
customer_reviews.text: Runs Overwatch, rainbow six siege, and PUBG all at 100+ frames at 1440p max settings. The triple fan design helped the card stay under 60 degrees when its under load. Overall Great quality "I am receiving points in the ROG Elite Rewards loyalty program for my review" <-- good added bonus if you join asus reward program
customer_reviews.author: ricky

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy
customer_reviews.text: I can play COD MW on highest settings, runs Fallout76 with ease, laughs at Borderlands 3. Its a great card for what I need. I game about 24 hours a week, over 3 days, and the card never skips a beat.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Card, and worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This graphics is a monster in size; but it fit with room to spare in my CORSAIR Obsidian 500D RGB SE Mid-Tower Case. Cooling isn't in issue with this case as I have over 4 intake fans and 1 out take fan to circulate air throughout the case. Frame rate per seconds and graphics are amazing while gaming and streaming online.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 days then kaput
customer_reviews.text: Was a hell of a run, dont know why I thought getting this card would be a good idea after reading the reviews on here and new egg. Thanks ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Defective Video Card
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend this card... the one I ordered was defective out-of-the-box. This card is very big, taking up 3 slots in my PC case.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Firman

customer_reviews.title: This thing hauls ass
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, Nvidia amd ASUS managed to squeeze several monsters into this card. i have yet to play a game that it couldn't shrug off. absolutely insane performance. very stable so far. and it has RGB. truly an overpowered card.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Sako

customer_reviews.title: Amazing video card.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this and everything was good, with the exception of the crashes on Apex, which was currently fixed with a new driver update (about damn time)
customer_reviews.author: Tim98277

customer_reviews.title: Great card for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this card for a little while now and haven't had any issues with it. I can run most new games on ultra at 60fps. This is a big card and i would recommend getting a gpu support bracket if you don't want it to sag. having the aura sync lighting was a big plus to me because i have a windowed case with lots of lights in it. I am receiving points in the ROG Elite Rewards loyalty program for my review
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my GPU to the RTX 2070. Games were running great! But later the card started to artifact and I had to return it. Fully refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Myers

customer_reviews.title: DIE
customer_reviews.text: Died after a month of use I do not recommend buying it
customer_reviews.author: MHAMMED RAMADAN

customer_reviews.title: Over priced and didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it, failed after 2 days using it
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far this card in particular goes toe-to-toe against my 1080Ti in a lo of games and GPU workloads. Having a 2200Mhz boost during benchmarks is also nice. Update: Still holding up. I'm glad I waited several months before getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product; would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: The performance of the GPU is as expected. Everything is easily customizable and it is absolutely beautiful in my nzxt h500i! The only issue i have had from it occured only for a minute, once: the left fan would spin up, make a little bit of a vibration noise, then slow a bit, and repeat. This issue has not occured again, possibly because I customized the fan performance and this behavior changed accordingly. So all in all, not a bad purchase at all!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Givens

customer_reviews.title: Coil Whine - STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: ASUS doesn't consider coil whine as part of their warranty/RMA. Started after a driver upgrade to Version 456.38 after over 18 months of no issue. I'm going to sell this piece of crap on offerup and switch back to AMD. What a disgrace, ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Artifacting - Refunded
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to complete my new Pc Build. Unfortunately, the GPU was artifacting instantly on factory settings. Currently processing my return. I would recommend holding off if you want this card or just buy a completely different card as it seems several people have ran into the same issue as me. Update, Amazon has refunded me for this item. I have purchased the EVGA version of the 2070 now.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Moore

customer_reviews.title: Same issue after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Was working like a charm till July. I've just played pubg, bf v, lol etc. for 5 months and now boom. Amazon doesn't accept return or refund. I hope Asus solves this issue. It costs nearly double price to Turkey because of taxes and shipping fees. It seems seems my 700 bucks died. Worst gpu ever. Stay away from this series of Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Fatih Ates

customer_reviews.title: My nightware has began
customer_reviews.text: I just started to have the same issue we can see on others comments, for any game, from Age of Empires to Anthem. I bought this GPU on Feb. I started reinstalling drivers, rolling back windows and so on. Nothing works. That is very disappoint since this is a hi-end GPU "validated for 144 hours".
customer_reviews.author: andrebenite

customer_reviews.title: Good Card but disappointing performance at times
customer_reviews.text: Pros -- No artifacting. Card is going strong after 3.5 months. Aesthetically pleasing. Cons-- FPS in certain games is usually above 120, but drops to 35-50 occasionally which is crazy for a $600 GPU.
customer_reviews.author: NZXT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing card
customer_reviews.text: So far the card has been working good and handles every game without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but there were some problems
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten one of these and the bios was not proper so I had to return it and get a new one. This was annoying but I didn't mind but when I got the replacement I noticed it came with a broken fan blade, which was very concerning. However, it ran perfectly fine when plugged into my build but it does cause a lot of unwanted noise due to the unevenness of the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good card, but stop working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card to upgrade my previous card (obviously). I bought the card for $530 and it lasted two weeks. I would look for another card maker (msi). I kept crashing games, it uninstalled my drivers, after my game crashed.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Do you really want to pay extra for the name?
customer_reviews.text: My next upgrade will be a G******e A***s instead. This is a good card but when I can get the same quality and performance for less...
customer_reviews.author: Gary Eyerly

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in November of 2018, it lasted just over a year and a half before dying with no warning signs. Computer just shut off, will not turn on with GPU connected. After troubleshooting, I've identified the GPU is the problem as PCI-E lanes on mobo are still functional, and changing memory, clearing CMOS did not fix the issue. PC boots fine without GPU installed.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but perform with anything you throw at it
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my monitor to a 42" 4k screen but my old video cards couldn't keep up with the high resolution. I can now run any game at the highest quality without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: MadMaXXX

customer_reviews.title: gret ++++
customer_reviews.text: Great prodyuct, delivered fast and came as advertised. Will shop again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: It's a great card! It's quiet and I can run everything I have at high or epic graphics.
customer_reviews.author: woodrow

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not much performance increase compare to 2060. I will buy 2060 which is 200$ cheaper and has great performance
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Super is a better buy
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t buy this with the 2070 super around, but it serves me well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received a brick
customer_reviews.text: Artifacting and crashing I am going to try the evga ultra out hopefully that one works Edit - evga rtx2070 xc ultra gaming OC works amazing the cooling on it allows for more overclocking and runs incredibly smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this card
customer_reviews.text: After six weeks, the card crashed while starting a game. Now there are artifacts while trying to sign onto windows. The screen blacks out or freezes with squiggly artifacts mid screen. This was a new computer I put together six weeks ago. Very disappointed and frustrated with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Barretta

customer_reviews.title: Item faulty  refurbished  r used
customer_reviews.text: Card work for 1 turn on. Ran game battlefields v Hr I noticed blue sparked shot out of the psu port . I turn off pc n unplug psu card turn fan run but no video. Thought it burn out my whole rig. Never by graphic card. Use again. Company slow to processed refund also.
customer_reviews.author: vu le

customer_reviews.title: Quilty of product, unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I need to know how I can return my item, unhappy with the item, it's not what excepted! Not satisfied with I need too return the item back.....and credit my card
customer_reviews.author: witzy1970

customer_reviews.title: Great card awful tech support
customer_reviews.text: The card is amazing, zero issues, awesome proformance, great looks. The only issue is the free promotional copy of battlefield 5 that was offered, the key didnt work and i tried contacting asus, amazon, and nvidia and they all just blamed the others and i never got the game.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Simkins

customer_reviews.title: Fans didn't work
customer_reviews.text: My game crashed after 3 or 4 mins in, the fans weren't kicking on. Most importantly the box was labeled amazon warehouse inspected. I will be returning this item with a note stating the issues, so no one else will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dan hang

customer_reviews.title: Failed within 30 days of purchase
customer_reviews.text: When this product was fully functional it was exactly what you'd expect: 200+ frames on 1080p resolution. Worked well for a few weeks Now it's tearing video and showing visual artifacts before crashing consistently. Totally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and returned two of these cards because they did not work. They crashed my computer while operating games and tech support had no valuable input
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: monster
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to have any issues in any of the games i play most pulling well over 150+ FPS on most games
customer_reviews.author: Hossbaby

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months of Great Gaming Until the Card Crapped out.
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues and great gaming during the initial 6 months. Then my system spontaneously shut down and would not power back up. Removed the graphics card and system started up fine with the mother board's built-in graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: So far works good but haven’t had a chance to take it to full potential. It is a huge card though. Takes up a good chunk of space.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: You won't get the Redeem code which sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that saving a few bucks I didn't get the redeem code and it seems my computer has crash a few times and that's never happen before....IF this keeps happening I hope to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Major Artifact Defects in card!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for a friend in Egypt, paid the cost of shipping $200+ and the card malfunctioned and thru artifacts from the first day. What a waste of a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Keown

customer_reviews.title: Loves it
customer_reviews.text: Love it😍😍 built my first PC with this card and I'm not disappointed at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Card longevity is questionable
customer_reviews.text: I used this card for really Harvey gaming. It’s an amazing card graphically, however, mine has already died less than 6 months of owning it. Really disappointed about it if I’m being completely honest.
customer_reviews.author: Jourogers

customer_reviews.title: Great gpu all around
customer_reviews.text: First build amazed at how everything came out really good gpu. for the price and what ya get along with it, put this in my ryzen build, has handled everything i have thrown at it with ease at ultra settings, good bang for your buck if you can afford it I recommend the 2080 but other then that completely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Randal M.

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG STRIX GeForce RTX 2070 Overclocked 8G GDDR6 VR Ready HDMI DP 1.4 USB Type-C Graphics Gaming Card (ROG-STRIX-RTX-2070-O8G)
product_meta.description: Style:ROG STRIX OCASUS ROG STRIX RTX 2070 O8G delivers legendary ROG power and performance with Turing Architecture from NVIDIA. Supporting up to 4 monitors plus a VR Ready headset, each card features a reinforced frame, triple Axial Tech fans with Max Contact technology for increased cooling, and Aura Sync RGB for customizing your lighting.
feature_bullets: Powered by NVIDIA Turing with 1845 MegaHertz Boost Clock (OC Mode), 2304 CUDA cores and overclocked 8 GigaBytes GDDR6 memory
Supports up to 4 monitors with Display Port 1. 4, HDMI 2. 0 and a VR headset via USB Type C ports
Auto Extreme and Max Contact Technology deliver premium quality and reliability with aerospace grade Super Alloy Power II components while maximizing heat sink contact
ASUS Aura Sync RGB lighting features a nearly endless spectrum of colors with the ability to synchronize effects across an ever expanding ecosystem of AURA Sync enabled products
GPU Tweak II makes monitoring performance and streaming in real time easier than ever, and includes additional software like Game Booster, X Split Game caster, WT Fast and Quantum Cloud
Triple Axial Tech 0db Fans increase airflow through the heat sink and boasts IP5X dust resistance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars428 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
